Classes¶

class bhp_entry_rules.classes.Controller¶

Bases: object

Main controller of RuleGroup objects.

autodiscover()¶

Autodiscover buckey rules from a bucket.py.

  • Copied from django sites and only very slightly modified
  • Auto-discover INSTALLED_APPS admin.py modules and fail silently when not present. This forces an import on them to register any admin bits they may want.
register(rule_group)¶

Register Rule groups to the list for the module the rule groups were declared in; which is the same module as the visit model (see update).

update_all(visit_model_instance)¶

Given a visit model instance, run all rules in each rule group for the app_label of the visit model.

class bhp_entry_rules.classes.RuleGroup¶

Bases: object

Container for ModelRule for a given rule group.

RuleGroups are contained by the Controller

class bhp_entry_rules.classes.BaseRule(*args, **kwargs)¶

Base class for all rules.

get_action_list()¶

Users should override to return a valid list of actions for consequent and alternative actions.

For example [‘new’, ‘not_required’].

get_operator_from_word(word, a, b)¶

Returns the operator from the ‘word’ used in the predicate, for example ‘equals’ returns ‘==’.

get_predicate()¶

Gets the predicate, but return value may be ‘’ or None, so users should check for this.

get_source_model_instance()¶

Gets the source model instance but users should check if the return value is None.

is_valid_action(action)¶

Returns true if the action is in the list of valid actions or, if invalid action, raises an error.

reset(visit_model_instance=None)¶

Resets before run().

run(visit_model_instance)¶

Evaluate the rule for each target model in the target model list.

set_bucket_cls()¶

Sets the entry bucket class but users should override

set_entry_cls()¶

Sets the entry class but users should override.

set_filter_fieldname(filter_fieldname=None)¶

Sets the filter fieldname that is used to filter on the source_model_cls if a source_model_instance is not provided.

set_filter_instance()¶

Sets the instance to filter the user model, for example an instance of a visit model or registered subject.

set_predicate()¶

Converts the predicate to something like “value==value” that can be evaluated with eval().

A simple predicate would be a tuple (‘field_name’, ‘equals’, ‘value’) meant to resolve to ‘value’ == ‘value’. A more complex one might be ((‘field_name’, ‘equals’, ‘value’), (‘field_name’, ‘equals’, ‘value’, ‘or’)) which would resolve to ‘value’ == ‘value’ or ‘value’ == ‘value’.

set_source_model_cls(model_cls=None)¶

Sets the source model class.

The predicate refers to an attribute of the source model class.

set_source_model_instance(source_model_instance=None)¶

Set the user model instance using either a given instance or by filtering on the user model class.

If the source model instance does not exist (yet), value is None

set_target_bucket_instance_id(bucket_cls)¶

Users should override

set_target_content_type_map()¶

Sets the content type for the target model to help locate the target’s entry bucket instance.

set_target_model_list(target_model_list=None)¶

Sets up the target model list for this rule by converting model names to classes.

class bhp_entry_rules.classes.ScheduledDataRule(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: bhp_entry_rules.classes.base_rule.BaseRule

evaluate()¶

Evaluate predicate and calls ScheduleEntry class to updates bucket instance status.

Note that if the source model instance does not exist (has not been keyed yet) the predicate will be None and the rule will not be evaluated.

set_target_bucket_instance_id()¶

Sets the bucket_instance_id for the target model knowing that the filter instance is either an instance of BaseVisitTracking or RegisteredSubject.

Users should check if the set value is None which will be the case if the current visit does not contain the target model.

class bhp_entry_rules.classes.AdditionalDataRule(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: bhp_entry_rules.classes.base_rule.BaseRule

evaluate()¶

Evaluate predicate and add/remove an entry from bucket class.

set_filter_fieldname(filter_field_name=None)¶

Returns the field name for the foreignkey that points to registered subjectl.

set_source_model_instance(source_model_instance=None)¶

Always sets source_model_instance to an instance of visit model.

set_target_bucket_instance_id()¶

Sets the bucket_instance_id for the target model
